question: <image 1> What does it signify if no fungal fruiting bodies are found in the area affected by the fungal pathogen, even when they grow on the host leaf?
options: ['The cause is not a fungal pathogen.', 'The cause is either bacterial or viral.', 'The cause could be a fungal pathogen.', 'It is an abiotic problem of some sort.', "I don't know and I don't want to guess."]
description: The image shows a close-up view of a leaf with a circular area of discoloration. The affected area appears to have a yellowish-green hue with some brown spots concentrated towards the center. The surrounding tissue of the leaf is also yellowish-green, indicating potential stress or damage. The overall appearance suggests a localized infection or lesion on the leaf surface.
